dublin_core.dcvalue: The purpose of this study was to compare the interpretation of conventional radiographs transmitted by a video teleconferencing system to conventional viewbox interpretation for both artificial and in vivo periapical bone lesions A total of 30 radiographic images were used in this study 20 radiographic images of artificial lesions and 10 radiographs from actual patients Two endodontists evaluated the 30 images by giving a yes or no response when determining whether a periapical lesion was present on the radiograph The study was conducted in two sessions separated by a 6 wk interval to minimize evaluator recall Results of the study revealed no statistical difference between the ability of the evaluator to identify periapical bone lesions using conventional radiographs on a viewbox and his ability to interpret the same images transmitted on a monitor screen
Interpretation of artificial and in vivo periapical bone lesions comparing conventional viewing versus a video conferencing system.
